It goes with the territory and don't act like a bitch when you find those things here. This is not a place that has a huge selection of beers, or pretty young attentive female bartenders. So go here with the right attitude and you will have a blast. Great (i mean GREAT) live blues, no cover during the week and only $5 on weekends, cheap drinks, and all types. They may look scary but looks are deceiving. I have been here many times and never witnessed a problem. Go here, listen to music, and enjoy!

WcyofRg-nXjgyacvgHSw4Q.review_text: On Cinqo de Mayo, 2006 I was on my way from having a few slices and beers at Golden Boy to meet some friends on Broadway. I never made it that far because I was drawn into The Saloon by the sound of live music. It was Lisa Kindred, one of the best Blues singers I've ever had the pleasure of hearing. The prices of a drink, like anywhere else in San Francisco really, is a little high, but it's well worth it for the amazing music and matching atmosphere. This definitely rates as one of my favorites places to throw back a Makers neat.  You need to go here, and you need to make sure you see Lisa Kindred when you do.

LkM20gbDNUqXnGM1tLldlg.review_text: If you want a shiny, clean bar where you can go pick up chicks and watch the game...this is not the bar for you. Not even close. If you want a stiff drink poured by a surley old bartender in a dive bar that looks (and smells) like it's a hundred years old, all while listening to a live band play some good 'ol fashioned blues/rock/jazz to a crowd of 40 - 60 year olds dancing their asses off...well then, you've come to the right place.  The saloon is just that...a saloon. Divey is putting it mildly, but man...they do it right. If you're really dying for a beer, get bottle of Bud or a pint of Busch on tap (that's right, Busch on tap) because that's about all they have. Otherwise, order yourself a whiskey and coke (be sure to ask for the tall glass for only like 50 cents more) and watch the bartender pour you a mighty stiff drink for dirt cheap. Once you have your drink in hand, sit back and watch the live band that plays in there pretty much every other night, or get out on that dance floor once you're properly intoxicated and mix it up with the old folks.

Sfgfz2Awh2EGPJvoEwwhKQ.review_text: Ron Hacker and his 4 buddies are live tonight in this very diverse gathering of 51 patrons crammed into this night spot.11 songs made up the first set. Great evening enjoyed by all!

5VyzxNY0xvDKVYaULIgHog.review_text: This place is amazing! Great music, great drinks at a very reasonable price, and amazing staff. Will definitely come back!

JIre_yzVACUswW78n0jzbA.review_text: Fell in Love with Lisa Kindred Band!  Bought her CD while there and have been listening to it ever since!  One of the funnest spots in San Francisco by far!  Bernard Anderson - I love you man!

FH_58ovtah1RPbamLxy4nw.review_text: only place in north beach worth a visit. best crowd, best attitude, great music.

TL2S7Lnka6t5kUOofr8Krw.review_text: This place blows. One of the bartenders appeared wasted and spilled drinks. As soon as the bar closed, the 'bouncer' started yelling for everyone to get out. Asked for water and he said rudely, "No. I'm not washing another glass." My friend was pushed by his trashy girlfriend and they got into a fight. Not a good time.

Q-Ysf1K_CaZbo3ZGUW_zUg.review_text: I agree that there is a serious older crowd here - but regardless of age, everyone comes here for the music and to dance. The live band was bluesy and the crowd was going nuts. It's pretty tiny so be prepared to get smacked on the dance floor by strangers. Drinks were damn strong. Had a great time!!

KQJadAAWioqQj02mujVkIg.review_text: Great music  Cheap drinks  CROWDED  Selection limited for a beer enthusiast like myself.  But the music made up for it. If only they had a more space and a bigger dance floor...

JseBksW8DVL596kJ18GGpA.review_text: My New Boyfriend works here. You might recognize him: long white beard, chew-stained teeth, been stationed at the front door of this historic den for alcoholics for approx the last 30 years. I never tire of his stories of breaking up bar fights, and he gives me free stiff drinks. It's like a match made in heaven.  The bawdy bartender, who also doubles as a CD pusher for the band, the always-amazing live music, and the mix of barflies and scared tourists--well, if this place gets any better, I'd havta hire someone to help me enjoy it!  The only down side is that my New Boyfriend has more suitors than you can shake a harmonica at, so I might keep the green-eyed boy around just in case....

R2p221627ZK5IhFBVI0OzQ.review_text: Love this place. It has old music you'd hear from different time periods, cheap drinks, really drunk old guys who look like they've been sitting in the same spot for 20 years and people dancing. This is a good place to come with friends but perhaps not a date that you want to impress anyhow.

4bJJVPYQrPaQ_EHoa6WmZg.review_text: I heard awesome music coming from this little place while I was passing by columbus and went in. Crowded place, nice bartender, awesome music. People dancing to blues. And this was on a TUESDAY night!  If you're in your 20's: As with most blues places in the U.S., expect quite a few older people. But I felt that this bar had a good mix of old and young people. Another good place for blues is Gold Dust Lounge at union square, but that definitely had a lot more old people, and the music style was also older (happy-go-lucky kind of songs, contrast with more guitar-heavy stuff that I heard here).   Would definitely frequent this place in the next few weeks. Good place to come with friends or just to have a chat with the bartender.

zhMY628j23fJJzbzHhfOcQ.review_text: Why don't I come here more often?

sXLAy83l7EwdZjsYFbaq0A.review_text: If you like blues, booze (or not), a little - or a lot of booty shakin, and you're not a choade, then, I highly recommend gettin yourself on over here. Cool, dark bar with requisite divey bathrooms, and old timers.  Amazing live blues bands.  What surprised me the most was hearing a booming deep blusey voice belting out some blues. And, all of that was coming from an older, tiny, geee-tar playing, Asian woman, dressed like she just came from her office cubicle!  Not only did she rock singing the blues, she is a bad-ass guitarist too!  She even sang a blues song that she wrote while in Japan, and sung it in Japanese.  She got a lot of people (even me) to get out there and shake what their mama gave em'.

_Idlsaw2hXJN8NtNWamt2Q.review_text: Warning Sign Posted: "One Drink Minimum Per Person" Really? Is this a problem? Warning Sign Posted Part Deux: "No Loitering."  I do my best loitering in dive bars.  Confess: I was going to give this place two lowly stars, but I was clearly there too early, no band (yet?), and perhaps on an off night. I was one of about 5 people, present company included. And now that I think of it, I'm usually one of the oldest people in the bar... Not so here! I was a baby comparatively. And the only girl.   The drinks were cheap. The service wasn't so friendly, but I'm betting after a few visits, it would improve.   Well, maybe.  We dropped in here on a lark, and, truth be told, while I love dive bars, I think I met my match. But by all means, go! listen to some blues! don't loiter.

5j0QmE-ktdY2wfEYX2YStA.review_text: I have walked past this bar often ... never daring to go in ....... not sure why .. well that was until my pops was in town.   Pops is a great fan of Blues and Jazz and loves to dance. We had had a few at Maggies .... popped into Grant and Green and decided to check it out ...   What can I say! ? !   This place rocks! It goes back a lot further than i though and although still small has room to dance the night away .. which we did!   The bar staff are speedy and mix very strong drinks for a bargain price .. $3.50 for a voddy ... mmmmmmm!!!  I will definitely be going back ... I'm so glad I ventured into this little gem.

YiGC7JeOi0PvMIHUKMUyZA.review_text: Imagine that weekend night that happens every once in a while where you're kind of tired and don't REALLY want to go out but other people are depending on you so you kind of get yourself out of your couch cocoon and wipe the stir-fry sauce from your face.  Got it?  Yeah, that's what I was feeling when my friends said that they were going to "this place called Saloon in North Beach."  So I drag myself out and head up there and have to pay cover?  Totally lame.  I mention to door guy that I'm looking for my friend, tall and blond and he says "that tall blond guy that hit me in the back and spilled my f-in' drink??" and I'm like "haha....no...." as I walk up to the blond drink spiller and give him a hug.  But aside from covers and the occasional angry large person, the Saloon was an absolute blast!    I was so incredibly happy that I went.  The blues band was amazing to the point where you can't NOT dance.  Everyone is so happy and rockin out.  The sax player is this older woman who has crazy pipes and jumps on the bar and gets the audience to scream into her mic.  Everyone I was with agreed that we have to start going there consistently.  It kind of reminded me of that bar in the movie "Wonder Boys" that they go to, but with a live band and a little more energy.    The bartender seemed cool.  SInce it was too loud to actually communicate, I just pointed to Anchor Steam, he nodded, gave me the beer, put up 4 fingers, i gave him a 5 and he just pointed at me which I took as "you're the man" but may equally have meant "i'm going to eat your first born."   Saloon is not a place to wear clubbing clothes or anything you can't break it down in.  Basically, the more you look like your parents, the better you will fit in.  In a nutshell, Saloon isn't the cleanest place, but if you like to dance to blues and don't mind hanging out with the older crowd, it's the type of place you'll want to take visiting friends to show them that San Franciso is the shit.

hRoCRf3hBMJH05CdUFkFAQ.review_text: I was in town on business looking for some watering holes to frequent for the duration of our contract. So my coworker and I walked in and grabbed some CASH ONLY (fyi) drinks, watched some patrons dance and nearly killed myself climbing down in the men's room to take a leak. Overall the lady behind the bar was friendly and overworked. The crowd came in to enjoy live music and it was fun.

pb1-wJAf-ZGkggABtMq73Q.review_text: You can't get any more old school than The Saloon.  I used to come here well over 10 years ago but hadn't been back in a long time.  I happened to pop back in a few weeks for the first time in years and I was rewarded wth some kick ass american live blues band. I don't know who the band was but I just couldn't believe how this place continues to deliver.  This place is an institution and needs to be preserved.  Great eclectic semi rough croed but you can't consider yourself a san franciscan if you have never been to the saloon.

vUyImCKoz4S7iMKUddD_gQ.review_text: You should come here for one reason,, and only one: to hear great Blues in San Francisco's oldest bar, the Saloon, established in 1861.  It's a dive bar but isn't that where the blues belong?  No food. Cash only.  Limited beer selection, Anchor Steam is the only craft beer, but who cares?  Did I mention it has great blues?  4 pm on a Saturday afternoon and people are dancing to the terrific Dave Workman Band.  Feels like 4 am in Chicago.  Correction: they also have Lagunitas IPA.

wLrj5eS2BZAMKu8vbKKJpA.review_text: Shame on me for happening to have randomly just stumbled into this bar late on a Sunday night!! As a Bay Area native, a 15-year food and bev industry veteran (in the process of opening my own establishment in SF), and someone who has literally lived 3 blocks from here the past 12 months of my life...I am ashamed to say tonight was my first time patronizing the 'Oldest Bar in SF.'  Now dont get me wrong, it smells like the oldest bar in SF; but the drinks were stiff and cheap, the bartender was a friggen joy, and the band was GREAT! If you're not from around here and visiting this lovely city, do yourself a favor and swing by The Saloon...It wont be anywhere near the most posh, trendy, or expensive place you'll spend your time at while youre here...but it'll make sure you leave your heart in San Francisco.

8htYBIDxeU9SK5F3cDaLTg.review_text: Awesome bar!  It's packed with locals and regulars who are super friendly...maybe too friendly.  Saw a guy in a cut-off sleeve looking for dance partners all around even after he got denied by a number of women.  He got his girl in the end though because who can resist dancing to some awesome blues music.  I ended up speaking to a regular who told me about the history of the place which was awesome--he looked like someone that's been through it all.   Don't come here expecting a trendy bar with fancy cocktails, because you're going to be sorely disappointed. PBR on tap--'nough said. Come here for the local flavor, the history, and some great music.    Bring a dance partner!

balhXuT7Pa2Sqb3cuTkDRA.review_text: Pretty fun blues/jazz bar with a great vibe. There's a one drink minimum per person which is not bad at all. The band is really good and energetic. It's a little divey and smelly but once you get on the dance floor, none of that really matters anymore.

fjvLxW976IgZwHj6YmOIDw.review_text: Okay it is what it is and if you can deal with that, you will love this place.  The music was incredible - jazz band - bass play was AJ and they were amazing to listen to and had everyone going crazy in the little place.  It is the oldest bar in the city, the drinks are cheap and the staff all looked like they had been there since it opened (the bartender said he had been there 29 years!), but we loved it on our bar hop.  The customers at the bar were entertaining and friendly - if you are easy going and like to have a good time hangin, you will love the place!

YbZg36FoMgkKcTEPae5siA.review_text: Wow. Just wow. I don't care if you're the oldest dive bar in SF if you're going to treat your customers like crap. The only reason they're earning two stars is that you can enjoy some pretty decent live music and I'm all for supporting a local place that gives musicians a place to thrive.  Cash only. One drink minimum PER person. As soon as we walked into this bar, my friends and I received attitude from the female bartender. Why not card everyone in our party instead of singling out certain people? Every drink I asked for they didn't have and then she responded with, "Can't you see we don't carry that in our bar?"  Um, it's your job to know what you put in the drinks not mine last time I checked. Lose the attitude, lady because you'll end up losing customers and possibly your job. It's not like I asked for anything that they don't carry at most bars.  She took awhile to take my friend's drink orders too. I get that you're busy and you're the only one working at the bar but the attitude won't earn you a good tip. They only were getting beers which apparently were posted on a sign because when they asked what was on tap she just pointed to the sign hanging pretty high up on the wall BEHIND the bar. That's a great place to put it considering we were facing the bar in the opposite direction. Thanks for being SO helpful. (I'm being sarcastic can't you tell?)  Since I obviously couldn't sit there without ordering a drink (I actually read the signs unlike some people). I walked out of the bar annoyed by the 'tude. You're not getting my hard earned money with an attitude like that.  I know why you enforce the one drink rule because you don't want people going and loitering in the bar to hear live music and this is the "dive bar" mentality at some places but in order to earn respect you have to give it and I didn't get any from the staff at this bar. I like most dive bars and I don't mind a little dirt and some character but this was by far one of the worst experiences I've had at a bar in SF.  It's too bad because this bar, unlike a lot of bars in the city seemed to attract a much more diverse crowd than other bars in SF and the prices seemed reasonable.  I'd only go back to listen to music and if they actually stocked something I could drink. Sorry, if my tolerance to alcohol doesn't live up to your standards but in order to survive, you're going to have to adapt to your customers' needs until then I won't be patronizing this bar or telling my friends to go here either. We are the ones that are keeping you in business and helping you earn your paycheck.

WbPrQlOtQsUC1kdeJBAfAQ.review_text: What a fun place! In spite of the location, it's not a tourists hang out, sort of older local hang-out. I'm with 3 women, we initiated dancing and other people started dancing. Cheap drinks with no cover charge. Had an awesome time.

eMGu2IN_pW602rtqVk__vw.review_text: A friend led me to this joint during a city wide bar hopping trip on his birthday. This is the only place that truly stood out for me. I've been back more since. There is a feel to this bar that is unlike any other. You can feel the history in the walls and get a sense that the way it is now is not so different than the way it was decades ago. There is always live music of the rockin' blues variety. People are always dancing with various skill levels, the extremes being the most entertaining especially when they dance right next to each other. You'll see a Elaine Benis style dancer next to a John Travolta. I'm sorry I'm not that versed in dancers and their dances so my anology suffered. In any event it's a good time.

1nNQa2cHJUcsaK_gMlC7wg.review_text: How we got here, I don't know... What a joint, immediately we meet several locals each having their own history of the bar.  Dubbed as the oldest saloon in SF, probably has not been cleaned since it's Grand Openning.  One of the stories was that it survived the Great SF fire of 1906 because it sat high on the road and that the above hotel was a brothel.  The night of the fire a bunch of navy men on liberty were using the facilities and help stave off the fire by pour buckets of water around the saloon to preserve their favorite brothel....Anywho, Harry comes of of the place and says "bro you have to use the men's room"  weary of glory holes any other surprises local to SF I said hell no, I don't have to pee.  He insisted that this will be a memorable visit.  By memorable meaning getting raped, forget it.  After bribing me with drinks, I finally checked it out.  What a cluster f#$% of a rest room.  As you open the door, it is filled with graffiti, you have to go down seversl steps, navigate low hanging pipes, and survive the stench.  I come out of there saying man that's a bitch to get out off, then Harry says imagine if you were in a wheel chair!!!! There were no shortage of freaks going in and out, walking by and just hanging out.  There was this thing about 6'4'' and had high heels and cheap make up.  Looked like Dee Snyeder in an evening dress, after seeing this thing it was time to go. What an experience.

JAY1GmMWtRwA2VgV1ylvug.review_text: Fun, loud music with a lively crowd of passersby, tourists and locals alike. Reasonably priced for North Beach with mostly bottle service and full bar with Pabst on tap. I'll definitely return!

KAvSJ995EvF3pBYcTKBeoA.review_text: The Saloon is a great place to go to see live music and dance the night away. They don't serve many complicated drinks there so just expect to drink beer and whiskey the bartender - mind wiped by years of drug use -  didn't know what Red Bull was.

hE34xpG35WugHznWf79HfQ.review_text: I truly thought that a dad getting a hooker for his son on his birthday was one of those things you heard about but didn't REALLY happen. I haven't met anyone yet who can confirm that this is how they spent their sweet 16. They just know someone who knows someone from the back hills of Montana who lost his cherry somewhere in Reno after a long road trip and some quality bonding.   At least that is the story I had until I came here and saw it with my very own two eyes. Except the son was 21 and still hadn't been laid and the dad was getting himself a piece of the action as well.   This is the sort of random scene you might stumble upon at this worn down hole in the wall that's has been around long enough to see it all. You never know exactly what you are going to get, with the exception of a strong drink and some kick ass live blues and jazz. Its just that sort of place. Full of surprises while providing a consistently interesting time each time you walk through the door.

KPWVxic04yevbAfvLEaJtA.review_text: I stopped in on their 150th anniversary just to check it out.  I had no idea what to expect.  Luckily, I saw Ron Hacker and the Hacksaws perform for several hours.  Ron is an incredible musician and if you ever have the chance to see him, you should go.  I've watched many Blues bands over the years and was not a huge fan.  Ron absolutely takes it to another level.    The bar itself is the quintessential dive bar, as indicated by beer signs and the small fake multi-color Christmas tree on display year round. The cover is never more than $5 and the mixed drinks are very cheap ($5-7) by North Beach standards.

0H5ZRiO19kt9ozOzBmDDSw.review_text: I really like this bar.  Although I am not really a regular I have come here for a lot of years and for me it has a really warm old san francisco feel.  Lots of drunk by in large friendly people, cheap drinks, and pretty cool bartenders.  It's nice to go on weekday nights when there is no cover and not too crowded.  Lisa Kindred is a great  local singer.  Once I also saw chicago blues greats Louis Meyers and Jimmy Rogers there also.

W_ds8g8jSNf2DLHcCHexxA.review_text: This is such a kick ass bar that seems so hard to find these days. The blues bands that play here are great and everyone is really laid back, friendly, and easy going.   The Saloon holds a lot of history, being the oldest bar in SF. If you're looking for a trendy bar, keep walking!! The age of the crowd here ranges with a lot of middle aged patrons who know how to have a good time.  Cash only!

JF-7fBtuA_l5R650Iqe7RQ.review_text: This is a true dive in the middle of North Beach.  Cheap drinks, good music and excellent characters abound.

O2WjTCsuIWMxhejj-4aGHA.review_text: Legendary experiences start here. Strange but nice people, ice cold tap beer, the men's room is like Frankenstein's toilet. I would say its the most unique place on the planet. Planet Saloon, that's what I'm calling it now. Don't pass up a chance if you're in the neighborhood. If you like your bars a little rough, sticky, or dusty then you'll love the Saloon. Its the real deal.

3S-HXvKWDwW6AFjVDNtryw.review_text: The service was incredible and the drinks were stiff. Great live band and all the regulars were incredibly welcoming.   If you're looking for fancy, go somewhere else. Looking for friendly and comfortable?? Get here already!!!   Also, being cash. They don't accept credit cards.

E37wtDFsSBJampwkmi0lBQ.review_text: Oldest bar in SF and a fun place when we were there. Ambiance ain't much to write home about, but it's ancient and the live music was killer, of which was playing with no cover at 430p on a random Saturday. Only cash.

r1BM6Jb4VKT_aRanY5fxcQ.review_text: An SF institution.  I just can't shake this place off.  I keep wanting to go back.  Awesome blues (local bands and etc.), decent bartenders (never knew what happened to the 1 female bartender from 2002) and definitely affordable.  It's also a good first date place to scare the bejesus out of him or her.  Last time I was there, I had a great time, but the bathroom was backed up.  What can you say ?  It's definitely not for everybody.

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: Cheap, liver destroying drinks; what's not to like?  I'm glad they keep this tiny bar clean but it only took a couple of minutes to start tasting the Pinesol that was heavy in the air.

p5iEpz8IHpLySQHsjlTy5A.review_text: This is one of my favorite holes in the wall to go in the City.  I have a passion for good ole blues guitar and this place does not disappoint.  One of my fondest memories was walking in with a friend and being the only ones under 40.  I realized then that this place was all about the music.  I ordered my favorite drink, a filthy martini w/ extra olives.  It tasted like dishwater but I should have known better.  I proceeded to get drunk enough on those sub-standard martinis to belt out a reverse rendition of "You lost that lovin' feeling" during a break from the live music.  The bar seemed entertained by this impromptu performance and clapped at the end of my inebriated display.  This place breathes character, charm and AMAZING music.  Not for the faint or yuppie at heart.

oQba6A60HadfVKakbi2jXA.review_text: Hole in the wall, ancient place.  A little warm inside with the heat on but hey its not bad.  Incredible place to go listen to some music and cut a few dance moves.  Must see pub as 1 of the oldest in San Francisco.  CASH ONLY place which is kinda a negative too, most people only carry plastic these days! :)

zDltf7SGyDANcA6ndZkF7A.review_text: I get it, The Saloon is a SF staple, a landmark, blah blah blah...and ya know, I enjoyed my incredibly stiff drink. But it smells like pee in here and maybe it's the "Marina" in me but I just can't deal.

QuZbJquRtbY9O9JrB9NpxQ.review_text: I heard this is the oldest bar in town.  I'm not sure about that but it's old, old school dive bar.  There wasn't much going on when we dropped in other than the bartender dancing to Motown but it was early in the evening.  I was trying to pace myself (you see, lately I have been having honchos from corp meet me in SF and they want to bar hop late in to the evening...cool by me but I need to be able to function, hence the pacing) and I momentarily lost my judgement...you see, I ordered a Jameson with ginger ale.  What I meant was ginger ale back but the bartender took it as a mix request and promptly shot back, "I won't do that to Jameson. Rocks or neat?"    Props to the bartender.

W7fnLf_rH3uIyrOTux_KBQ.review_text: This is a great place if you want to hear the blues.  I've been here several times when I'm in town, and it definitely lives up to the "divey" reputation.  Not that it's bad, but if you're expecting glamorous food with your Pinot Noir, you're at the wrong place.  Are you ever!  Blues, cheap good drinks, and local color.  Enjoy it or don't go here.

legEZzXG28Hy0ikwMnOLzQ.review_text: What a whacky, throwback, total dive bar. Walked in at 3:30 on a Friday afternoon & a kickass rockabilly band was already rocking their asses off.   Fun bunch of characters in there, too. PBR is the only beer on tap. Cash only.   I dunno, maybe you just had to be there... but I'll definitely be going back.

5_hVNmcBE-nZtok3otLThQ.review_text: Great place to relax after walking around Downtown Half Moon Bay... awesome atmosphere, great people, good beer and bloody mary's, and from what I saw, the food looked good too!

T8jYpkC7F8Tyv6IFy5u5UQ.review_text: Great place if you like jazz and blues. Don't judge it by the shady looking entrance. The band is 3 feet from you and there's just so much energy every time I go.

4JwyxbHSr4mcdabVKL-WNA.review_text: absolutely unbelievable.  live music that's soo much fun to dance to.  it's nice to be on a dance floor where I'm not concerned about guys grabbing my ass... why do they think they can do that?  there's always lots of locals hanging out, the place is super divey, and it's the best place in the city to hang out on a sunday afternoon or a random weeknight.

b1Iu7lgKqMB6i-6-bXjmfQ.review_text: Go for the history, not the ambiance or clientele... Wine from a box....I say nay nay

GCuDiPUKYxhgFHP5LqJa2Q.review_text: Come for the music - they always have an awesome band playing, kid you not...  The booz (I can't believe I'm saying this) is secondary here - of course, one can have a lot more fun throwing down a few BUT the music will get you either sober or not.  You can't beat this place for diversity from bikers to yuppies...the lady behind the bar is coolio.  I think we scored a brownie point with her when we declined a glass for our beers - quoting her "I really appreciate that..." and our reply "...no prob - tastes better from the bottle!".  Yes, the place has an overwhleming scent of Lysol cleaned bathroom as you entered but that just means they are clean.  The bathroom is cleaner than a lot of joints around town so take that!  Go and have yourself a swinging time!

tweNOS3Bqz863y6PyyVxVA.review_text: Man I miss The Saloon... I've only went once, and I ended up there by accident. My friend's and I were wondering around this area looking for a good place to drink, and there it was. I immediately recognized the bass lines to Albert King's Born Under A Bad Sign, and I knew it was the right place.  The rest is history. Eugene Higgins and his band were playing there, and MAN they rocked!!  This blues bar ain't pretty looking, but it sure gives a nice saloonish environment that I sure dig. The music is awesome, and the crowd was really cool too.  The only issue I had was that they didn't have beer on tap... I had a couple of bottle beers, but once they have tap, it's an easy 5 star from me!!

8J9JdSl0d7z9sSsIjgl8HQ.review_text: This place is great! Fairly priced drinks and live music are a combo I'm always down for. I went here for the first time and caught a smoking rockabilly group called The Bachelors who perform every Monday night. It was great and their set ranged covers of Elvis' "Little Sister" to "Miserlou" to The Ramones "I Wanna Be Sedated", rockabillified.  Also, I got to watch the bouncers toss some asshole who was harassing the bartender out on the street. (I had to call the cops for the guy's own protection because he wouldn't go away and I was afraid they'd beat him senseless). I don' t know about you, but for me this constitutes a fun night. An aside--not be a "hater," but I'm kind of not into the current rockabilly fad: These guys transcend all that BS with full-out, authentic dive bar rockin'

NkVYcoaThHjOfTTgq6OdHQ.review_text: i think this is supposed to be the oldest bar in SF... it sure looks that way. always an older crowd but if really look, you can tell these are probably the same people who've been coming here since 1975. happy drunk people dancing in the little alley on the side, a loud band playing inside, harleys. this place has its own personality that i dont think you'll find anywhere else.

BaveUVWRiGX6Y8IFPcEb1g.review_text: The oldest bar in San Francisco. It really felt like it too. Not really a decent selection beer. Nice for nostalgia but they really need to replace their loos.

_peJ2KUBkpBhKMoYFwkiaQ.review_text: Been here twice in the last 3 months and last night proved our experience in April was no fluke. Exceptionally nasty bar staff, terrible drinks in tiny glasses (but cheap as they should be), gross bathrooms and several patrons that are "uppity" (as our friends said). The saving grace - and reason for 2 stars instead of 1 - is the live music was quite good on both occasions. Not much room to dance however. We will do our best to not come back!

Dt3Nxfwa4LonEG_R5b1sCg.review_text: We love dive bars but this place was getting close to too divey for us. The bartender was a 70 year old woman that seemed to be on drugs and had no teeth.  She shorted us 10 dollars in change and gave it to the girl next to us and had no clue because she was helping too many people at once. They let kids into the bar which I found funny. It was awesome that a blues band was there and it was no cover just one drink min...but the lead singer was creepy the night we were there... He kept staring at all the women constantly. Interesting experience.

txWFXIMtDUaheiePKnAQyg.review_text: I would give the Saloon five stars had it not been for the terrible service and inexcusably weak drinks.  The blues band and singer were nothing short of brilliant.  I mean, the singer was wearing a full bright red suit and rattled out a thirty minute song about how his wife threw him out of the house after he didn't come home one night.  Really, how can you go wrong with that.  And then all the old foges got up and started kicking up their heels . .  . it really feels like you've been transported to South Carolina . . . or California in the 1800s, I suppose.  But my god, you practically have to kill a bitch to get the bartender's attention, even early in the evening.  And after five greyhounds, I began to realize that they were sadly devoid of alcohol.  Anyway, it's certainly a good time, but be prepared to wait forever or wave your arms around desperately to get a drink.

77otvQtuEXYqapllbbLqQQ.review_text: Of all the dive bars I've been in, this joint is ...  one of them. As other have mentioned, the most impressive thing about the place is the smell. Good blues. Surly service. Oh, and it's old. Overall, a remarkably unremarkable experience.

hj77ZKZk2W0UVb58upEeuw.review_text: This is one of the oldest bars in California. If you come in early during the day you have a change to sit around and talk with old beatniks, hippies and artists. This is my favorite bar, by far. They also have amazing live music.

xQ-iIsDqwhmiAhbtwP3Ezw.review_text: Takes awhile to get served. BUT, the music-------- FANTASTIC!!! I love this place!!!

ACwy7fi__QndA_zsaLnU9w.review_text: San Francisco at its finest!!!  I've never found anywhere else in the city where you can order two  whiskey on the rocks and a gin tonic for under $8 bucks total.   The bouncers at the front door looked straight out of zz top. The bartender was probably more drunk than I was, and the band was this amazing old Jazz group that probably formed during the summer of love.  It was a totally dive... and absolutely incredible. For those of you who found this place offensive... do us all a favor and go back to your yuppy martini bar where the drinks are $18.

DpiMuxg2g4urzClzjykUHg.review_text: The perfect bar. Show up, order a drink and start dancing. When your parents come to town, bring them here for a fun time. The blues is amazing. The band wants you to get out and dance and they don't care how you look while doing it.  If you don't have fun here, you've got problemas....ha!

LNwtLORYeEQK9yfH-rPGdQ.review_text: sometimes my thoughts and opinions are more easily expressed via lists......  Amazing Things About The Saloon:  1) hidden amongst gross clubs and clug go-ers in N. Beach.  2) the bartender who looks like he has worked there forever.  3) cheap drink......like really, cheap drinks.  4) the dressed to the nines, octogenarian couple that waltzed in, danced to two songs, took everyone's breath away and walked out.  5) the group of yuppies who seemed to think a monday was a good night to do a lot of drugs and scare everyone off the dance floor.  6) the AMAZING band, The Bachelors who should be local celebrities for sure.  best. thing. ever.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: It gets extremely crowded in here, especially on nights where a band is playing. Speaking of the band, after I got a drink, I went to the very front where the band was to snap a quick photo of an awesome group. While standing up there, some woman told me, "you need to get out of here" and pointed away. My first reaction was that she was an employee and there was no photography allowed so she was regulated. I was pulling out my wallet to donate to the band which never happened because of this incident. Retrospectively though, I think she was just really drunk and because I wasn't doing white-girl dancing, she didn't want me to be in front. Too bad--the band would've came up a few dollars. Sadly, this represents my experience of The Saloon, one of the oldest bars in SF. Because of this terrible person, I had a bad time here. I still got a couple good photos of this awesome band. I paid $5 for cover for an OK experience. I would very much like to check this place out on a non-cover, non-busy time just to "be" in the essence of this old drinking establishment. Sorry Saloon, blame this terrible patron for this 2-star review.

7p5nTW9Tpw_3VDC4vuLSBQ.review_text: Wow, One of the best bars I've ever been to!!!! We saw Curtis Lawson and his band there, rocking the house and the drinks were loaded and cheap. Luvv this place, San Francisco's oldest bar, the bartender are kick ass and so is the crowd. The patrons were down to earth and very chatty, would definitely go back and throw some drinks down there again. Luvv The Saloon.

ugHHCgv-MU3mPfSuHBHNlA.review_text: LOVE THIS PLACE!!! It is a bit small, but that adds to its charm I think. Inside you can dance to live blues music and it is absolutely a blast!!!

9mp-1oHJU0Z-bouISJa35Q.review_text: My favorite bar in the world. The people that work here and the people that come to get their drink on are some of my favorite people I've ever spent an evening with. The Bachelors have played every Monday night for 20+ years, and never get old even after seeing them over 50 times. The bartenders are old-school and actually know how to properly mix drinks like an Old Fashioned. And I don't think drink prices have changed since 1999. I will be devastated if this place ever changes or remodels. Thanks to owner Myron Wu for keeping this place "real."

T1onvez6kj1aKChjFQCTOQ.review_text: Scenario: Too many people at Maggie's so my friend showed me this place.  Product:  The live blues was unexpectedly phenomenal.  The beer was cheap.  What more do you need.  Too bad there was a cover, but it was necessary that night, being so packed.  Service: Ha!  Atmosphere: Where the hell do I start?!?  It's a saloon.  No really, a SALOON.  The patrons are baby boomer age.  The chicks look like biker chicks.  The dudes look like biker dudes.  The guy at the door could be Willie Nelson's half-cousin.  The bartender's voice was rustier than a Pinto.  And that other guy at the bar was eyeballing me somethin' fierce like I was gonna take his beer or something.  There are signs around letting you know you shouldn't park you motorcycle in the alley.  It was crowded, which is unusual according to my friend.  Uniquity: Good music, or good bad music.  Either way you're golden.  And $3 Bud with a very laid back crowd.  I told my friend if I brought a girl here some day and she liked it I just might marry her.

8yOtbrH9VMAHQjsJrBqLtQ.review_text: I understand that this is certainly an iconic blues dive bar (one of the oldest in sf), but it smelled like SHIT!! I've been to plenty of stinky dive bars in my time, yet, this one takes the cake. I would have probably stayed and got schnockered, cause of the strong cheap drinks, however, it smelled like someone died, losing their bowels in the process. Honestly, I think they had a busted sewer pipe, I'm not shitting u (pun not intended).  The music is fun and they have a gig lined up every night.  I'd probably give em 3.5 stars because of music, cheap strong drinks, and a pretty cool bartender (the big dude in the biker vest). Just make sure u bring your nose plugs.

T4E1PMvIF78PKVMXnYcuRw.review_text: Solid neighborhood bar.  I believe this is the oldest bar in San Francisco but I'm not sure.  They often have live music which is a nice treat in a bar these days.  Bartender is a pro.  Efficient, fast, friendly.  All around a great place to drop into when you're in the neighborhood.

gTxigDuZ9BIKmkRsjQ5vMA.review_text: The Saloon remains one of the last old school Blues Bars in San Francisco. There was once the Blue Lamp on Geary. But it metamorphosed into the "Swig Lounge..." The term "old school," really does apply in the case of The Saloon. This is reportedly the oldest bar in town. Those drunks of years past had to be careful walking out of the place in the post Civil War years, to avoid being shanghaied on some random ocean voyage. The bar sits on Grant near Columbus. When you walk inside you'll see why it is still simply called, "The Saloon.."  The place has remained the same for years, with a long bar, old wooden planks for a floor, and the same bearded door man.. The Saloon's building somehow survived the 1906 earthquake, and has held onto it's authenticity despite the ever changing landscape surrounding it. I can think of no better place in San Francisco to enjoy a stiff drink while listening to live blues. Tommy Castro used to play here along with some others.  Johnny Nitro jammed here on Friday and Sunday nights. The man was a local legend on guitar. Somehow when I am drinking a jack and coke here, I feel no guilt, no pain, only good spirits of past and present.   Sadly I just heard some tragic news regarding my favorite resident bluesman at the Saloon.... Rest in peace, Johnny Nitro.. The late great pope of North Beach. sfgate.com/cgi-bin/artic…

NTXyiQRHvc_IjsuFmJt--A.review_text: I love The Saloon.  The bartenders are nice and happy to serve.  The music is some of the best you'll hear in the city.    The last time I went here, a lady came out of the bathroom with white dust on her nose, grabbed a broom from the broom closet and began sweeping the floor.  She only had one arm and I'm pretty sure she did not work there.  Not wanting to stare, I moved over a bit and a man with no teeth began chatting me up.  Thing is, I felt completely safe the entire night.  Bring your dancing shoes.

mveiiXTA_CU8RsSKAZZx5g.review_text: I'm nearing 50 but the night I went with a 20+ colleague, I was younger than most by about 20 years.  My workmate was downright overshadowed.  The music great - the bassist was blistering, the drummer was phenomenal.  The crowd was having a great time, maybe because at this age, you don't give a ***, you just want to have a good time.  That meant that it felt friendly and relaxed and fun.  The price of the same bottle of beer fluctuated, but it didn't matter. It's the kind of place you wish you had in your own city.

apX-FaMlzeBDx38Tba2nUw.review_text: Oldest bar in San Francisco, established in 1861. Great blues, cheap drinks, and a fun crowd.  You can't help but dance too.  Go there tonight!  Oh yeah, and after don't forget to grab a slice at Golden Boy.

4BXqlLKW8oP0RBCW1FvaIg.review_text: I spy with my little eye a bar that looks very familiar to me in this crappy romantic comedy called "Just Like Heaven" with that actress Reese Witherspoon and her crazy chin.  Why yes, I've been to that bar.  It's the Saloon.  The only reason I have ever been to the Saloon is because of my sweet, blues obsessed Dad and Uncle Jesse.  These dudes loooooove this place and would probably live here if not for the fact that they live many moons away.  So my Dad dragged my sister and I here one night.  We walk in to a sea of old timers and a few young ladies surrounding the stage area.  A blues band is playing and they are really getting the crowd going.  Dad, sis and I are just chilling at the bar sippin on cocktails and Dad is jiving to the tunes and making friends with the other bar flys and the decrepitly old bartender.  The drinks are poured with a heavy hand and Dad keeps them coming.  This place gets pretty packed for a weekday night.  The vibe is cool to my surprise.  I had a great time at this bar and will probably never come back on my own, but will definitely accompany my Dad next time he's in town.  ***** i forgot to mention that my Dad calls this bar the "Star Wars Bar".....due to all the freaks.  Dad is funny.

FI0dcCAuFmW0lutdKO2UwA.review_text: A good place to meet hungry out of town cougars looking for a good time.  The place has a cheap slutty feel to it.  No attitudes, cheap booze and live music that the cougars love dancing to.

9OXGWy6UWCxZFCAlezlg3A.review_text: Don't let the view from the outside keep you from coming in and having one heck of a great time at The Saloon. There's always live music played by guys that know how to play music and have a great time doing it. The dance floor is filled with tourists and locals alike all groovin to the tunes and the cash only bar drinks. Come on in and get up to get down!

FWyjAgtNrIEnFOF7Ba_Cag.review_text: It's been years since I last reviewed the Saloon, so I thought it time to re-visit the oldest bar in San Francisco.    OK, by day it  remains a loser bar.  And yes, despite an occasional hosing it  still  smells faintly of urine and bleach.  And, in truth you probably shouldn't visit the bathrooms unless it's an absolute emergency.  BUT, by night the place becomes a rockin' blues joint, with cheap drinks, a friendly crowd (tourists and tons of locals), and absolutely the best live blues this side of Memphis.  North Beach favorites Blues Power hold forth most Sunday afternoons, Ron Hacker on a Saturday night is not to be missed, and in fact all of the music is so good that you really can't go wrong.  If you don't get to dancing here, you just don't dance.  This place is still, hands down, my favorite bar.

5tQxgSFYHGNWFoWC7k7_hw.review_text: I've been going to the Saloon for over 25 years, and it's always been my favorite bar. On Saturday 8/23/14 I stopped in with my girlfriend and was checking to see who was playing that afternoon. While my girlfriend was in the restroom I was talking to the bartender, but he was being a total dick so we decided to leave. Later that afternoon we were taking pictures in North Beach and of course I wanted a few of the Saloon. While I was taking pictures my girlfriend pointed out that the RUDE bartender was flipping us off. Over the years I have spent thousands of dollars at the Saloon, and brought in tens of thousands of dollars if you count all of the people I brought with me. What a great way to treat a customer that's been going to the saloon since the 80's. I have one star because the bartender was a total ass. I would have given less if I could. I suppose if he had not have been there I would have given 5 stars and I would have stayed around and enjoyed some cold beers and killer blues by Perry Welsh. But that wasn't going to happen with "Mr Friendly" working behind the bar.

ctr_BlCf3Ogny-vLs8E9tQ.review_text: Dirty, but oh-so-North Beach.  Go here for Blues Power on Sunday afternoons  but skip that ass-hat Johnny Nitro.. He's a douche. :)

7mzACXQ5F4EduE9jF_tI-g.review_text: Being from a small town in WI as soon as I walked into this place I felt home... If you can get past the musty old bathroom smell this place is great!   Born in 1861 its been around a long time.. and the drink prices haven't gone up much at all... its a great place if you are a fan of Blues, we drank and danced our night away..   The crowd is a good mix actually of old townies and people in their 20s  As for the bathrooms... I was afraid to enter, but it was clean, and smelt better than the bar itself (I hear the mens room doesn't lock however)   ....in conclusion: I definitely recommend this as a great dive bar/ blues venue!

9kvzAuCNFpuu-Smx2Uf4FQ.review_text: I am 24 years old and still had a blast at this bar!! I was in SF for the weekend to celebrate a friend's Birthday. We had a party of 12-15 so it was a bit difficult to get everyone into a bar/club that wasn't going to charge us $15-20 per person to get in. Definitely not a typical bar I would go to. But, did I sure have a blast.   I go up to the bar & order a VO & 7 and a Vodka soda. The bartender told me the total which was $7.50. I asked him again...yup $7.50!! I couldn't believe it. I told all of our friends and we all decided to stay there & drink up! The drinks were unbelievably strong....just how I like it!   I had to only give 4 stars because it was very hot in the bar and there were some sweaty elderly people. But for cheap drinks, free cover, and a live band I couldn't really complain. Ended up having a great night!

eQJtcM6rK0-x2F2UlZaNJg.review_text: This place still rocks, but if you've been here before then you know that.  It's nice to have a good old standby Saturday afternoon bar to have some drinks and enjoy live music.

OqgYxqEHc9K7oq-8VHJgxw.review_text: Supposedly the oldest bar in all of San Francisco and honestly I am not going to challenge them on that.  Dark wooden decor, a sticky floor, a door guy who looks like zz top.  Live bad ass blues with no cover charge and $3 bottles of bud.  This place is killer.  The only thing that didn't win me over was the clientele which seemed to consist primarily of 55 year old bearded men who were absolutely shit faced on crown royal.  Still this place rocks !

xpkoIsSm6NVQdyVIhY_PkA.review_text: Dive bar is right, crazy mix of patrons, but I loved every minute of it!  The live music?  The blues band was great (and I speak as a musician) and even got up to play harp with the band on Red House.  No attitudes--I was a NYer on business trip who felt immediately at home at this place--just a terrific time.

qSPFhtM-eO842BVQXtAMNg.review_text: Yelp needs various classifications to differentiate star levels.  Case in point; The Saloon.  If you have never been here and saw my 5 stars you would wonder what the hell was I smokin/drinkin.  Well that is none of your business!  I have a history of loving dive bars, just all the character/characters of most of them, and like The Saloon, many have oodles of historical significance.  The legend states that this bar survived the fires caused  by the 1906 earthquake because there was a brothel upstairs and the firefighters didn't want to lose such an important, ahem, business.  It is also the longest continuously running bar in the city.  See its a historical landmark, how much more credibility does one need?  Ok, and now on to my last visit on Sunday 11/15/09, arriving around 6:00 for some live blues.  Again, love dive bars but on this occasion I have the lady friend in tow.  I did give her a little bit of a heads up on what to expect as she is a polite, sophisticated lady in her 50's, but didn't want to scare her off either.  I remember playing up the historical thang to peak her interest.  This particular visit did not get off to a great start.  Frikken Hells Angels milling about outside the door.  LF tugged on my jacket..."are you sure about this"?  Oh yeah, they are a friendly bunch, cmon!  Place was packed but we found 2 empty stools near the door.  1 stool spot had a pack of smokes and a beer bottle on the bar.  LF sat and the occupier of said stool came up behind me and grabbed his smokes and bottle, "sit brother sit"!  Turned around to give thanks and it was one of the Angels!  See honey, what'd I tell ya.  About peed my pants, don't tell her that though.  Well, the band was great, the crowd drunkin and friendly, met an interesting bloke from New Castle UK that was traveling the world, and the drinks were cheap.  Service great as well, plus it was the btenders bday and cake was passed around to all.  Oh yes, the bathrooms. Phew!  Sitting near the door was a good thing.  The men's room appeared to have been recently cleaned but 100+ years of missed targets cant be washed away.     Great time again at The Saloon.  Hopefully this doesn't start the LF on the road to ruin......

cKydps_ldogI7jNZD9SE6Q.user_location: South Los Angeles, Los Angeles, CA
cKydps_ldogI7jNZD9SE6Q.review_text: I was on my way back to the hotel and heard some great live music. I stepped in and I was the only one under 30, under 40 and under 50 along with two 26 year old girls from NY. The place was truly awesome even without the girls (which as a big bonus I became friends and spent the next two days with).  An old cool lady was running the bar alone and everybody got what they needed. The band was playing great music with nice variation and people were dancing all the time.  If you want a big slapping bass drum, neon lights and red bull vodka, this is not the place for you, but for a good time and to meet interesting characters it's worth a visit!

9BvoWCj8l6xX5r02-Vh_8Q.review_text: A small, cash only, blues pub with great atmosphere, live music, dancing, and lots of local color. Loved it. I will go back every time I am in SF.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: In a world of uncertainty, there's one thing you can continually invest your faith in: the fact that you'll never go wrong with a hang at The Saloon. Great people, great live music, and maybe one of the sketchiest bathrooms outside of Buddha Lounge in Chinatown (that's not necessarily a bad thing).

KVT2jasQOCe2cSotn4b-Ug.review_text: Authentic. Laid back. Older, steady/daily drinkers line the bar counter. It is filled with characters to observe and talk to. This place is for people who don't have sticks up their butts, people who just want to have a few and bullshit with people. Live music Monday nights. Go in, have a drink, and I bet you'll make some memories.

UHl56Gr_-wMDS_rFLEj6jA.review_text: A great hole in the wall for *REAL* Blues Lovers that don't bother real messy places!!!  I loved it!   One of the two men behind the bar is deaf on on ear: you need to waive your hands like a crazy if you want to catch is attention!  Great music and athmosphere.

aNra-PY5GVKqRVUX4yat1A.review_text: A small and decent place to hear live music and have cheap drinks. The older, female bartender was a bit scary (although, I'm easily intimidated) so I sent my boyfriend to buy drinks. The blues band that played were good, but not spectacular. The big crowd that showed up seemed to really like them, and it was great that the place was so busy on a Wednesday night. The place smelled bad though, like faulty sewer pipes, and there are too many rules posted all over the place.

wveSuWGNDD9H4g1h_0XGpA.review_text: There's no avoiding the fact that this place smells like old, damp sneakers...  But if you can put that fact aside, the oldest bar in San Francisco is so much awesome!  Live music, interesting/diverse/insane patrons (& staff) & the fact that it's an SF institution mean a visit to The Saloon is worth your time!   Personally, it's the kind of place I like to make a quick (1-2 drink) stopover at... but it's always tempting to stick around once my sense of smell subsides...

U7XGOj-5t0HtIhpXvKIPdA.review_text: This place is smelly, old, full of crazy people and... absolutely amazing! I came here really curious after a cab driver told me this was the oldest bar in San Francisco. I knew they had live music and was not sure what to expect when I walked in. The first thing that got my attention was how smelly this place was! Then I noticed it also seemed very old and even a little decadent. Well, it is over 150 years old, after all. You are probably wondering why this is a 4 star review...  Ok, so as soon as I sat down at the bar and started paying attention to the music (really great blues on the Sunday night I was here), I just got it. This place is SO unique and SO San Francisco! Young, old, weird and classy, everyone got together to dig the music and show some moves on the dance floor. In a way I felt like I was in a movie with all of these extremely peculiar characters surrounding me: the red haired lady shaking her ass like a mad woman; the sweet bartender with his long white locks and very slim figure; the barely naked lady dancing as if there was no tomorrow... Everybody was having the time of their lives and it felt pretty magical to watch!  When the band had a break I left to have a cigarette and ran into some people on the little alley outside. Soon enough this guy who I had just seen dancing inside asks for my name, grabs a guitar and starts playing me a song, rhymes and all. I smiled, danced and kept thinking to myself "this place is the real deal!". If you are not into all of the very particular things I described above, maybe this is not the best bar for you. But I just loved it and will totally come back next time I am in town!

wAw9FHMiOZd9ROoc5x4DpQ.review_text: this is the ONLY place in north beach with real people and real music.  I love the crowd.  Unlike the uniform patrons at the bars around the corner (i.e. collared shirts tucked into jeans), anything goes here.  Party next to an eclectic group of people with one thing in common: a love for the music, the atmosphere, and life.  Okay that was three things.  The live blues band on Thursday night is fantastic.  Get ready to be out-danced by 60 year women with more stamina than you had at 21.  There's a $5 cover, but the drinks are cheap.  This would be a great place to "test out" a new beau.  If he's too stuffy to enjoy himself here, get rid of him stat!

mtpek5XdI8oqrA5KCGFXZg.review_text: The Saloon is a the dive of all San Francisco dives - a great spot to do some day time drinking with some weird and crusty locals while listening to the Allman Brothers on the jukebox. Only has PBR and Lagunitas IPA on tap as well as Budweiser, Sierra Nevada, Anchor Steam, and a few others in bottles. +1 for an extra large pour on my double jameson whiskey

kExQHEnm_gkxRbby-fauSw.review_text: This is a great place in North Beach to get cheap drinks--ultra wild west feel to it! It is apparently one of the oldest bars in the city. Cash only, FYI.

CN9uQWBl21FXWR2ZX1Cx0A.review_text: The Saloon is a love-it/hate-it kind of place. I would give it a 5-Star rating except for two things - the smell of the place and the attitude of one of the bartenders.  The place smells like urine. When I asked the doorman why the place smells like urine, he told me it is because people urinate on the street and public pavement within yards of the entrance door. When I walk through the front door the overpowering stench of urine hits me. It's like a wall of urine smells. After standing inside the place for a few minutes, the nose becomes acclimated to the smell. It would be great if the owner/management would clean up the place so that customers weren't hit in the face with the overpowering smell of a public latrine when they walked through the front door. Other patrons have told me they have the same experience each time they enter The Saloon - the overpowering smell of urine.  One of the bartenders is a real asshole - rude, combative, and surly. This guy should go away from The Saloon. Management should get rid of him. One time I went there to have a drink, listen to music, dance, and meet people. He was working that night. I decided to leave as soon as I saw that he was working the bar that night. I went somewhere else to have a drink, listen to music, dance, and meet people.

iqOaVJRprVKcT50t9k5jnA.review_text: Agreed with everything said here. This place is awesome.

QUV4kHoq-tCJ3CBHmhPjIg.review_text: I like to hear live music early in the day,4pm start on Fri and Sat. A classic Saloon with alot of history.The lady bartending last Saturday afternoon rocks!! Thanks for beeing part of a great San Francisco vacation.

GWKbtMoL9UEXN4fdMnO5Xg.review_text: I Fu**in love this place!! It's the oldest bar in San Francisco there is really good live jazz/blues music here nightly. Right in the heart of North Beach. Whenever I'm in town I always hit this place up.

tcAtgnSrs4nceMadnRo-bw.review_text: after going to some club that felt like a high school prom/ hip hop video my bf and i stubbled upon this bar. the music was amazing. it sounded alot like the black keys. the drinks were dirt cheap. $9.50 for two jamesons/coke.. wow. it smells like a good dive bar does. piss and wood. i loved it. i was so much fun. bartenders are very nice.

MZXfiLD_SXbPUxfQAIhJUQ.review_text: Musicians love playing the Saloon.  Which means you get to hear bands who are having a great time, taking more risks and sharing more joy.  On any given night you could set up a video camera and let it run and you'd wind up with a Jim Jarmusch film (if his camaraman had dropped blotter acid).  Hippies, hustlers, Hungarians and ass-shaking hominids of  all sizes, dancing like it was their last night on earth.

6M-zSMI_owxlN-GE2JYyww.review_text: of all places that I've ever been to, I never thought I would find a crisp, fresh, new and amazing salad here. It was awesome!

9u8d_na5feZSZYok-Wb-BQ.review_text: Quite a band.  A very old bar.  Whiskey cheaper than most in the northeast can imagine.

ZNJiYLz_6udX3ljXPZ9FJg.review_text: Wow - just thinking about this place puts a smile on my face.  I've spent many nights at this beloved blues bar.    Back in the day, I'd see Johnny Nitro and the Doorslammers here as many nights as they played  - it seems like they were either here or up at Grant & Green every night of the week except Tuesday - And I was there every night! (Or were they at "Blues" on Lombard on Mondays!?).    Johnny Nitro at the Saloon, however, was the best experience ever.  No performance was ever the same - they never played the exact same set, but knew just when to bust out with a regular crowd favorite.    For a small, cozy "hole-in-the-wall" type of vibe, the restroom was relatively spacious and decent.  The neighboring alley takes you straight through to an awesome street view.  The acoustics were surprisingly really high quality.The Saloon was always packed and always lively.  I've met the most eclectic group of individuals here - locals and tourists.  In the span of one night, I recall meeting three separate tourists who were told that "The Saloon" was the best Blues bar to visit in SF - I told them they were right and they heartily agreed. Another tourist had just come from a variety of U.S. East & West Coast city bars, and two other countries, on his vacation, and said The Saloon, in SF, was his absolute favorite of them all.    The Saloon will always have a special place in my heart... sigh...

AuZCYgJwe0j54QngjErbMg.review_text: We used to think this place was fun. Unfortunately past versions of ourselves were sorely mistaken. Drinks are over-priced and are very weak. The men's bathroom is designed for midgets and unusuable for anyone of average or above average height. The "bouncer" a very unhappy obviously unsuccessful late 50's Douche who most likely got beat up by 60's hippies back in the day, needs some training on customer service. We arrived at 8 pm, knowing the "show" began at 930. Having arrived before the "cover period" we assumed the cover charge should not and would not apply to the patrons who had been paying for weak drinks with poor service for several hours. The proprietors of the bar proceeded to shut music off at 930 and demand a cover charge from all current residents of the bar. I happened to be using the facilites during this shakedown and missed the collection jar. After buying a very weak drink from the bar upon my return from the little boys room, the bouncer jumped in my face demanding $5 and cursing at my party for not already giving the cover. He proceeded to recruit the bartender out from behind the bar to inform us they would no longer be serving us watered down adult beverages until we paid the cover. My first interaction with these people involved yelling and cursing despite my obvious intention to give them many of my hard earned dollars for crappy drinks and crappy service. We left without paying the cover charge based upon principal and extremely poor customer service. I am all for supporting local musicians, however the approach the proprietors of this establishment depend on are extremely crass and unnecessary. We will never return and I caution all those under the age of 60 looking for an enjoyable time on any day of the week ending in "day" to save your money and go anywhere else.

TknGTatZq_ABSuiNjuR0Gg.review_text: How am I just now knowing about this place? GREAT MUSIC, cheap drinks, fun crowd.... what more could you want?   Just stop in sometime for the music... it's completely worth it. Everyone in the place was dancing. You could just feel the fun. And hell, where else in SF can you get a $4 Manhattan? Is it shiny and fancy inside? Absolutely not. It is dark and dingy and full of soul. Go grab a nice dinner around the corner and then come here to wrap up the night. I will definitely be going back!

yCBeVvKt0M7o57sSRqp4xg.review_text: I went to this bar twice last week.  Yes, the place can get crowded and it wreaks.  But the grey-haired bartenders whip out those drinks fast.  This is a no-frills, kick-ass bar.  And the previous is correct, it scares away the tourists.  Great band (Jonny Nitro last Friday night) and a down home atmosphere.  ABC for this place (as in Always Bring Cash).  I shall return.

s3DLYu66f-cIU8BAkEzGow.review_text: Hands down the best blues bar in town. The place is old, it looks and smells old but it's vibrant at the same time. It's what you'd expect going into a blues bar. The drinks are cheap, the ambience is lively and the people are very laid back and pretty friendly. If you like blues or even if you don't, but you enjoy great live music, you're gonna love this bar!! Come in your dress shoes if you want my man right outside the bar to shine your shoes.

1XNK0BXBd1IDTq5GFkof5A.review_text: Just a great dive bar.  A  nice break from the usual around North Beach.  Cheap drinks, good music, and an eclectic mix of people that are all friendly and interesting to watch to say the least.  I don't get everyone complaining about the smell and the decor and the bathroom, it's an old dive bar.  There's no bells and whistles so this place is of course not for everyone.  But I think that's ok for the rest of us that can appreciate such a spot.

DorKHZt5ULB6O5-ItIpicg.review_text: Don't be a weenie: you're never going to see this place in the cold light of day so just ignore the stickiness under your feet, don't even THINK about visiting the ladies' room, and get over your shyness about shaking your money-maker in a crowd of sweaty, spirited strangers.  This place is about atmosphere, history and great music, not about fancy drinks or cleanliness. The only beer on tap is Pabst Blue Ribbon, but others are available in the bottle. Mixed drinks were adequate, but the music really is the focus. The patrons were a great mix of ages and backgrounds, and everyone was enjoying the slammin' blues of the father/son Chris Cobb Band.

bro5nR5w2N3adU-OrpRCJg.review_text: When I first moved to San Francisco I used to haunt Grant Street and its environs.  (When your name ends in vowel, you have to.  It's in the rulebook.)  Somehow I missed this place.  I am sorry I did.  Wandered in here with some North Beach denizens last weekend.  I am glad I did.  This place is a throwback, and I feel like I am violating an unwritten rule by even writing this "review", so I'll keep it short and sweet.  If you want to sit down and throw back booze, copious amounts of booze, like liver failure amounts of booze, then go to the Saloon.  This is an establishment dedicated to the fine art of getting drunk.  Order a whiskey, a rye, a bourbon, or a scotch.  If you go to this place and order anything that requires fruit flavoring, then you deserve to get thrown through the lexan.

dZfoX2qIfv2tY6fVBUWOQw.review_text: It wasn't what everyone described it to be.  It is definately an old bar!   I love dive bars but this one had a lot of scary people inside of it.

JsVB8eE-FOhJjf5hL0nNwQ.review_text: This place is for a certain kind of nightlifer. That being said, I LOVE it. The live music is always entertaining and the drinks are cheap. There's a chill, easy-going crowd. I should probably mention I'm from Kentucky, so The Saloon is a home away from home. The bartender gets super sassy, but she adds character and provides a great laugh. Cash only!

Tsc4u6B-hpvPPUPT2hTC4Q.review_text: This place is so much fun.  Live music, cold beer, and dancing!  I had a blast.... and so will you. Scout's honor.

SFezvszyVDN6lLZRRBJBtQ.review_text: Super chill. Good music. Liquor pours above half the glass. Enough said.

bPOwZhbJ0goXsE_-EwJ4zQ.review_text: OOOOOOOH man. This is certainly a place to stop in at. I wasn't a fan of paying a cover fee but there was live music and I'm all for that.  It's lively, it's loud, action pack and damn is it old(including a majority of the patrons).  There is nothing fancy here, it looks and feels as old as they say it is but it's fun and unique.  I would recommend stopping in this place for a drink and a dance, after having several others elsewhere. for sure.

JVTcskIsqBgyw7jTQC9GYQ.review_text: Jazzy bands playing worthwhile music. The drinks are reasonably priced, and the crowd is very relaxed and laid-back. It gets crowded as you would expect. Your usual red-faced-slushed individuals having a great time.

LggT45Di6ORgE_nrSI9Wtg.review_text: On a recent trip up to SF, my friends and I stumbled upon the Saloon while cruising through North Beach. (Stumbling is a frequent and welcomed means of travel in North Beach.)  In any event, I paid the $10 cover and went in with low expectations as can be expected of a bar called The Saloon off an alley from Little Italy.   I was pleasantly surprised, as can be expected of a bar called The Saloon off an alley from Little Italy that's jam packed with a diverse and friendly crowd, and echoing with searing blues licks of a kick ass house band.  I've heard a lot of house blues bands in my 26 years, and this was one of the best. I was so into the music that I forgot the name, but I think it was Danny Castro and the (somethings)? I could just be making that up.  The downsides to this juke joint are that the bar is cash only and has a limited selection of brews, and the space is pretty tight if there's a good crowd. Still, I was so down with the music and already buzzed from earlier in the night that I didn't care.   Seriously, the music was tight, and it was really great to see people of all ages and backgrounds getting down. It reminded me of the guitar duel scene from the Crossroads. Good movie, go rent it.   Back to The Saloon - I had a great time. I was loving the floor, I think I danced with a 70 something year old woman and a Tibetan midget. It was a great night.  Overall, if you're looking for a spot to let loose and dance to rockin' blues or bluesin' rock with a packed house, this may be your place.

lhd3w16Ct4Oo8Kc7711tpQ.review_text: Really small but cozy joint.  Place gets really loud, but the food is pretty good.

fxJcpYyCBgi61PtmlZXTjQ.review_text: I visited The Saloon to hear my friend's dad's blues/old school R&B band play here and had a pretty good time. It got kind of crowded and it seems popular among the local homeless, but the music was super good and I scored a bar seat so I could sit, see the stage and order drinks easily.  The bartenders are some very experienced, very on the ball "mature" ladies, the liquor and bottled beer selection is decent (they only have Busch on tap), and boy o' boy are the drinks CHEAP. Beers are $4, but the cocktails are only $3.00-5.00. I wouldn't come here regularly, but it's definitely worth a visit when a good group is playing. There's some room for dancing and the bathrooms are pretty clean.

32sxRjdlvBsQRiwuGQUeXQ.review_text: I came here last night and saw a pretty cool band with a mean female sax player who had a lyrical way of saying things.  I spent most of the evening people-watching with friends.  Weird crowd: lots of middle-aged men and women falling all over each other and getting really horny from the looks of it.  Shirts started unbuttoning and layers started coming off.  Young girls paired up with older men.  Female groups grinding each other for bearded white-haired crowds.  I saw one cool older couple that held each other close with lowered eyes while dancing, the whole time I was there.  The girl had vivid features and the guy wore a faded old cap.  Strange place.  The bartender is friendly and the drinks don't cost too much.  My ears rang a little - it's a small venue and the music's pretty loud.

OaCYI9jXPJJFOHqPmsjaWA.review_text: If you want to hear some great live music this is the spot!  Oldest bar in SF. looks old inside too, but the vibe is great. musicians are really good and people dance too.   first time hearing blues music live and it was fantastic.   However, if you have sensitive ears like me, I recommend some ear plugs to lower the volume. It's a small venue so the music can be loud. But not the completely sound canceling kind because you still want to hear the music.

Kg4VJYP60seaknupX3iP9w.review_text: I had reason to be here a few Saturday nights ago. It was one of the most authentic places I have ever been in my life. It was the way bars and music are meant to be. Natural and comfortable. You felt at ease. It is a 100% dive. That makes it 100% awesome. That's just the atmosphere.  I saw an artist called Daniel Castro - blues rock - sensational. Continuing the authentic theme, the music too was 100% authentic. The crowd was 50 plus although it become younger as the night went on.  It is in the North Beach area with lots of things to do either side of going to the pub. I don't get into the city that much but I am glad I found this place. Highly recommended.

pudxkSYxLCQw7dhupri24g.review_text: Old timey place. Crazy cheap drinks. Fantastically colorful bartender. Great live music.   If you are looking for a fun divey watering hole in the area, that doesn't have strippers, this is your jam.

Hl1f4VO0a9KdGrrRCPMqSA.review_text: I love real bars and this my friends is a real bar. And as I'm sure most everyone knows San Francisco's oldest. If you're in North Beach swing by, if only to break up your night of strip clubs and Golden Boy.

az9JYYsK7EpTc5CyFADzIQ.review_text: It doesn't get any better than The Saloon!  Don't let the "dive bar" thing scare you, seriously.   Keep an open mind and you'll have a blast.  Three years ago I walked into Saloon by accident and couldn't see why I'd hang out anywhere else....and I don't.  I love the people!  The "regulars" welcomed me; danced liked crazy with me; and are now friends I look forward to seeing!  And I take offense to some of the reviews about the bartenders....they work their butts off!  On any given night you'll see some of best live music San Francisco has to offer.  Tony Perez - awesome sax player - with Second Hand Smoke plays on the 3rd Saturday and it's a MUST SEE!  Ron Hacker & the Hacksaws, Daniel Castro, Curtis Lawson, Dave Workman, Lonnie's Eggs.....the list goes on-and-on.  The music is some of the BEST BLUES you'll find anywhere in the country!  I congradulate owner Myron Mu for keeping the tradition of San Francisco's oldest bar alive and well.

uJdI8qypazDBDV1WBU3LBw.review_text: This place is loud. The band will greet you from more than a few stumbles from the front door with electric blues. I live for institutions like this where that skanky bar smell that still has nicotine in the fine print.   The last time I remember actually sitting here, it was daytime, early afternoon, there was the sweetest skeksis bartender lady, I got the impression she was used to tending bar with her smokes but California had legislated that option away from her, she poured like they used to, like it was law, like an equalizer. After a few hours of sitting at her bar, quietly consuming Wild Turkey, I took in all that was around me. There are the clinical, the young, the old, the ones she wakes up, sets up and shoos out all sitting in consensus paying their courtesy at the bar. You might people who seem as if not everything is right when you look in their eyes. They might think the same about you. The insane might be you or they might be seated around you, dancing next to you or smiling to someone not even there. I love this place  This crowd has brothers and sisters drinking on 6th street and dancing in the doorways at 7 am in the 90's. You can find the ghosts of their cousins on Turk St on the corner of Taylor. All those places are falling away as the bureaucracy comes by like the revenue man with a clipboard, a minor and an old square chicken hawk. I'm glad this place has more stones than the ABC with a foundation since the Emancipation Proclamation and straight through Prohibition and the Twenty-first Amendment, punk rock, disco and crack.  I am going to go back, pay homage and promote sustainability so that The Saloon will be here when I'm gone. I won't get a last ovation but The Saloon will be a part of me as I passes into the urinal. They must have a bathroom but I can't remember if I used it in an official sense.  Like a reviewer posted earlier: dress for drinking. If you don't want a dive bar that your great-great-grand-daddy got shanghaied from that still has his dent in the door, from his head as he was thrown through, don't come by.

0eMHwMLptoOktuVUOYCdQw.review_text: Reasonably priced drinks and great live blues! Definitely a must while in San Francisco !

L6H3kqqmYz2NPkOl5WE6nA.review_text: Wow! Sunday nights at the bar with a beer and seriously good blues! Doesn't get more authentic than that!

gjF9IHmY4mNAysaSIALmQA.review_text: Classic dive bar. Good service but don't expect anything super fancy. Generous cocktails and good people watching. Go by for a drink when you are in North Beach.

nKAYiPsaCpNxAZ4Ot0IdzA.review_text: I love this place.  Great atmosphere, jazz bands, and cheap booze.  The only cons were that it only had one ladies bathroom and it was cash only.  However, I had a great time.....well worth the trip to the ATM.

6zLDYs2CTlrwCQpG2tZ4QA.review_text: Holy shit, what a find.  Jacqui, thank you.  What a joint - we walk into a live band playing James Brown, the bartender is f**cking hammered, they have Busch on draft (yet the bottled beer is still $3.50?), the person taking i.d.s looked like she was on a meth bender - all of these things I look for in a dive bar (one more Canadian Club shot for the bartender - oh wait, look he's doing one right now).  Back to the band - solid. Funky. And the drummer was singing most of the joints, pulling a little Phil Collins-Don Henley shit.  Nice work, I expect to be back at some point.

r1AVLdGIUI4pMjnTZgi1aQ.review_text: WOW... That's all I can say. I have never seen a straight up put up or shut up kinda place like this. This place is old school blues bar. Tobbacco Road has nothing on this place. The crazy thing is that the musicians are freggin good.   So, do not take your first date there. actually wait until you are married for 20 years to take her there. Because 95% of the people there are over 55, drunk and smelly. But I promise you will have a good time.  Oh, BTW the bartenders are deaf but the will pour you a Man's drink for 3-4 dollars.

LgT0KCtFvqWU-f0chxtWkg.review_text: "It is what it is"  Go in with that attitude and you will love it. I have been coming to the saloon for about 5 years now and am never disappointed. I would say with my scientific calculations, that the mean age of the crowd there is 56.7 (I am 27.1)  The bands are always awesome as well as the dancing. The drinks are stiff and cheap. Make nice with the bartenders and you will be served quickly all night.  ps. They have powdered soap in the bathrooms!!!!!

ZnoRV0CJYbKqHlWWm_6MIA.review_text: Ok I can only really give this an average rating because I walked in, and decided it was not happenin' and proceeded out the door.   Lovely smell of musty socks and onions with a sea of old people with live loud music filled this bar.   I think I got tossed back into time....

AUV205p4o2uk9o80LrKHhA.review_text: The oldest bar in san fran where people used to be shanghaied (not sure how to spell that, partially because i didn't know it was a real thing).
